segment.source: How to Add a Package by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Add a Package by Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Add a Package by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Add a Package by Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Add a Package by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Add a Package by Using the Command Line

segment.source: The following procedures list the steps that are necessary to add a virtual application package to the Application Virtualization (App-V) Client on a specific computer.
segment.target: The following procedures list the steps that are necessary to add a virtual application package to the Application Virtualization (App-V) Client on a specific computer.

segment.source: To add a virtual application package for a specific user
segment.target: To add a virtual application package for a specific user

segment.source: Run the following command under the user account of the person who is to get the package.
segment.target: Run the following command under the user account of the person who is to get the package.

segment.source: The command adds and publishes the package for that user.
segment.target: The command adds and publishes the package for that user.

segment.source: To add a virtual application package for all users
segment.target: To add a virtual application package for all users

segment.source: Run the following command under an account that has administrator rights.
segment.target: Run the following command under an account that has administrator rights.

segment.source: The package is added and published for all users on the computer.
segment.target: The package is added and published for all users on the computer.

segment.source: To add a package using an electronic software distribution system
segment.target: To add a package using an electronic software distribution system

segment.source: If you are using an electronic software distribution system that runs the commands under the computer’s SYSTEM account, the package is published for that account only, unless you use the /GLOBAL switch.
segment.target: If you are using an electronic software distribution system that runs the commands under the computer’s SYSTEM account, the package is published for that account only, unless you use the /GLOBAL switch.

segment.source: Run the following command to add and publish the package for all users on the computer:
segment.target: Run the following command to add and publish the package for all users on the computer:

segment.source: If you want to add the package for specific users only, run the ADD PACKAGE command, and then explicitly publish the package for each user by running the following PUBLISH PACKAGE command under each person’s user account:
segment.target: If you want to add the package for specific users only, run the ADD PACKAGE command, and then explicitly publish the package for each user by running the following PUBLISH PACKAGE command under each person’s user account:

segment.source: Publishing the package without the GLOBAL parameter grants the user access to the applications in the package and publishes the file types and shortcuts that are listed in the manifest to the user’s profile.
segment.target: Publishing the package without the GLOBAL parameter grants the user access to the applications in the package and publishes the file types and shortcuts that are listed in the manifest to the user’s profile.

segment.source: Permissions required are “Manage file type associations” (ManageTypes) and “Publish shortcuts” (PublishShortcut).
segment.target: Permissions required are “Manage file type associations” (ManageTypes) and “Publish shortcuts” (PublishShortcut).
